[[Oregon State Beavers football|Oregon State Beavers]] }} The '''Washington State Cougars football team''' is the intercollegiate [[American football|football]] team of [[Washington State University]]. The team is a member of the [[Pacific-12 Conference]]. Beginning with the 2012 season, they will be coached by [[Mike Leach (coach)|Mike Leach]], who is replacing [[Paul Wulff]], who was fired following the [[2011 Washington State Cougars football team|2011 season]]. The Cougars play home games on campus at [[Martin Stadium]], which opened in 1972; the site dates back to 1892 when it was called [[Rogers Field (Washington State)|Soldier Field]]. Its present [[seating capacity]] is [http://www.wsucougars.com/photos/schools/wast/sports/m-footbl/auto_pdf/2010MediaGuide.pdf 35,117]. ==Head coaching history== {| class="wikitable" |-style="background: #981e32" align=center | '''Tenure''' || '''Coach''' || '''Years''' || '''Record''' || '''Pct.''' |- align="center" | 1894 || William Goodyear || 1 || 1-1 || .500 |- align="center" | 1895 || W.W. They finished the 2001 season beating Purdue in the Sun Bowl 33-27. The Cougars then lost to Oklahoma 34-14 in the Rose Bowl January 1st, 2002. They capped the three year ride with a 28-20 victory over then #5 ranked Texas in the 2003 Holiday Bowl.[http://www.wsucougars.com/photos/schools/wast/sports/m-footbl/auto_pdf/2010MediaGuide.pdf Cougar Media Guide] ==Current coaching staff== *[[Mike Leach]] - Head Coach *Chris Ball - Co-Defensive Coordinator/Safeties Coach *Jody Sears - Co-Defensive Coordinator/Cornerbacks Coach *Todd Sturdy - Offensive Coordinator/Quarterbacks Coach *Dave Ungerer - Special Teams/Running Backs Coach *Rich Rasmussen - Recruiting Coordinator/Tight Ends Coach *Todd Howard - Defensive Line Coach *Mike Levenseller - Wide Receivers Coach *Steve Morton - Offensive Line Coach *Chris Tormey - Linebackers Coach ==Bowl games== Washington State has made 10 bowl appearances, and has a bowl record of 6â4. The Cougars have played in the [[Rose Bowl Game|Rose Bowl]] (1 win, 3 losses), the [[Holiday Bowl]] (1 win, 1 loss), the [[Aloha Bowl]] (1 win), the [[Copper Bowl]] (1 win), the [[Alamo Bowl]] (1
